title: Title
form_incomplete: The form is incomplete and could not be submitted.

helpers.files: Upload the file to publish from your computer, and specify its language. It is best to publish one file per record, however you can add more if needed. To see Standards and Naming Conventions click <1>here</1>.

helpers.title: Type the original title of the document. Try not to use abbreviations. To see Standards and Naming Conventions click <1>here</1>.
helpers.offices: Click on the field and select the coordination hub(s) the document refers to (if any).
helpers.publication_date: Indicate when the document has originally been published.
helpers.disasters: Click on the field and select the disaster(s) or emergency the document refers to.
helpers.bundles: Indicate the cluster(s)/sector(s) the document refers to.
helpers.description: Try to always include here the text (in full or part of it) of the document (example: use the introduction or the executive summary). If no text is available add a description of the file(s) you are publishing.
helpers.language: Select the language of the document.
helpers.spaces: Click on the field and select where to publish the document (operation, regional site or thematic site).
helpers.document_type: Select the document type and sub-type that best describe the document.
helpers.organizations: Type in and select the source(s) of the document.
helpers.locations: Select from the menu the country(ies) the document is about and indicate more specific locations by selecting multiple layers (region, province, town).
helpers.themes: Click on the field and select all relevant themes. Choose only themes the document substantively refers to.
helpers.related_content: Add links to content that is related to the document you are publishing (example: language versions of the same document, or the link of the event the meeting minutes refer to) by indicating the title of the content and its url.

helpers.title: Type the original title of the map/infographic. Try not to use abbreviations. To see Standards and Naming Conventions click <1>here</1>.
helpers.offices: Click on the field and select the coordination hub(s) the map/infographic refers to (if any).
helpers.publication_date: Indicate when the map/infographic has originally been published.
helpers.disasters: Click on the field and select the disaster(s) or emergency the map/infographic refers to.
helpers.bundles: Indicate the cluster(s)/sector(s) the map/infographic refers to.
helpers.description: Try to always include here the text (in full or part of it) of the map/infographic (example: use the introduction or the executive summary). If no text is available add a description of the file(s) you are publishing.
helpers.language: Select the language of the map/infographic.
helpers.spaces: Click on the field and select where to publish the map/infographic (operation, regional site or thematic site).
helpers.document_type: Select the map/infographic type and sub-type that best describe the map/infographic.
helpers.organizations: Type in and select the source(s) of the map/infographic.
helpers.locations: Select from the menu the country(ies) the map/infographic is about and indicate more specific locations by selecting multiple layers (region, province, town).
helpers.themes: Click on the field and select all relevant themes. Choose only themes the map/infographic substantively refers to.
helpers.related_content: Add links to content that is related to the map/infographicc you are publishing (example: language versions of the same infographic, or the link of the event the meeting minutes refer to) by indicating the title of the content and its url.

helpers.title: Type in the title of the related content.
helpers.url: Type in the URL of the related content

helpers.title: Type the name of the group. Try not to use abbreviations. To see Standards and Naming Conventions click <1>here</1>.
helpers.type: From the list, select the type of group you are creating.
helpers.hid_access: Select 'Open' if you want HID users to add themselves to this group. Select 'Closed' if you want only HID managers to be allowed to add HID users to this group.
helpers.body: Try to always include here the text (in full or part of it) of the group (example: use the introduction or the executive summary). If no text is available add a description of the file(s) you are publishing.

helpers.title: Type the original title of the event. Try not to use abbreviations. To see Standards and Naming Conventions click <1>here</1>.
helpers.offices: Click on the field and select the coordination hub(s) the event refers to (if any).
helpers.disasters: Click on the field and select the disaster(s) or emergency the event refers to.
helpers.bundles: Indicate the cluster(s)/sector(s) the event refers to.
helpers.category: From the list, select the kind of event you are creating.
helpers.date: Indicate the date of the event.
helpers.description: Add more information related to the event
helpers.address: Indicate here where the event takes place.
helpers.language: Select the language of the event.
helpers.spaces: Click on the field and select where to publish the event (operation, regional site or thematic site).
helpers.organizations: Type in and select the organization(s) facilitating the event.
helpers.contacts: Indicate the person(s) to contact for information regarding the event. To show up in the list, the person must have a HumanitarianID profile.
helpers.agendas: Add the agenda of the event as a document first, and then reference this document from here.
helpers.meeting_minutes: Add the meeting minutes of the event as a document first, and then reference this document from here.
helpers.locations: Select from the menu the country(ies) the event is about and indicate more specific locations by selecting multiple layers (region, province, town).
helpers.themes: Click on the field and select all relevant themes. Choose only themes the event substantively refers to.
helpers.related_content: Add links to content that is related to the event you are publishing by indicating the title of the content and its url.

helpers.title: Enter the operation name.
helpers.type: Select the type of the operation

name: Name

helpers.name: Type the name of the organization.
helpers.type: From the list, select the type of organization you are creating.

subject: Subject

helpers.title: Type the original title of the assessment. Try not to use abbreviations. To see Standards and Naming Conventions <1>click here</1>.
helpers.date: Indicate the start/end dates of the assessment.
helpers.spaces: Click on the field and select where to publish the assessment (operation, regional site or thematic site).
helpers.status: Indicate the phase of the assessment. Please remember to update this field as phases move on.
helpers.leading_organizations: Type in and select from the list the organization(s) conducting the assessment.
helpers.participating_organizations: Type in and select from the list the organization(s) taking part into (but not leading) the assessment.
helpers.locations: Select from the menu the country(ies) the assessment is about and indicate more specific locations by selecting multiple layers (region, province, town).
helpers.other_location: You can specify here a location not available in the Location(s) field list.
helpers.population_types: Click on the field and select the segment(s) of the population targeted by the assessment. You can select multiple population types.
helpers.subject: Insert a brief description of the topic of the assessment and what its goals are.
helpers.methodology: Insert a brief description of the procedures and the techniques used to collect, store and analyse the data.
helpers.key_findings: Insert a brief summary of the assessment’s results.
helpers.bundles: Indicate the cluster(s)/sector(s) the assessment refers to.
helpers.themes: Click on the field and select all relevant themes. Choose only themes the assessment substantively refers to.
helpers.disasters: Click on the field and select the disaster(s) or emergency the assessment refers to.
helpers.collection_method: Click on the field and select the collection method(s) used to gather information during the assessment.
helpers.unit_measurement: Click on the field and select the unit(s) of measurement used for the assessment.
helpers.sample_size: Indicate the number of communities/households/individuals surveyed during the assessment.
helpers.geographic_level: Select at what geographical level the assessment is (has been) conducted.
helpers.contacts: Indicate the person(s) to contact for information regarding the assessment. To show up in the list, the person must have a HumanitarianID profile.
helpers.agendas: Add the agenda of the event as a document first, and then reference this document from here.
helpers.meeting_minutes: Add the meeting minutes of the event as a document first, and then reference this document from here.
helpers.related_content: Add links to content that is related to the assessment you are publishing by indicating the title of the content and its url. When using the Search function make sure to search by content title.
helpers.language: Select the language of the assessment.
helpers.assessment_report: Upload the assessment report file, stored on your computer or on your Dropbox account, and indicate its level of accessibility. If the file is “Available on request”, write the instructions in the related space. To see File Standards and Naming Conventions <1>click here</1>.
helpers.assessment_questionnaire: Upload the assessment questionnaire file, stored on your computer or on your Dropbox account, and indicate its level of accessibility. If the file is “Available on request”, write the instructions in the related space. To see File Standards and Naming Conventions <1>click here</1>.
helpers.assessment_data: Upload the assessment data file, stored on your computer or on your Dropbox account, and indicate its level of accessibility. If the file is “Available on request”, write the instructions in the related space. To see File Standards and Naming Conventions <1>click here</1>.
helpers.frequency: Indicate the assessment frequency in case it is being repeated over time.

helpers.title: Type the name of the office. Try not to use abbreviations. To see Standards and Naming Conventions <1>click here</1>.
helpers.language: Select the language of the office.
helpers.location: Select from the menu the country where the office is located and indicate more specific locations by selecting multiple layers (region, province, town).
helpers.address: Indicate the address of the office
helpers.organizations: Type in and select the source(s) of the office.
helpers.spaces: Click on the field and select where to publish the office (operation, regional site or thematic site).
helpers.phones: Type in the phones of the office.
helpers.is_coordination_hub: This office is a coordination hub.
helpers.is_not_coordination_hub: This office is not a coordination hub.
